q: `` This has been the heart of the problem in Detroit,'' said Sergio Marchionne , who also heads up Fiat, the Italian auto company. Alan Mulally said Ford has learned that it has to deal with the current reality. You have to match production to real demand and accelerate development of new products that people will want to buy. For Ford that meant going with a plan for massive restructuring to a consortium of banks and borrowing$ 23.5 billion, he said. For GM and Chrysler it meant bankruptcy filings and huge bailouts

( Reuters)- Chrysler is working to refinance what its chief executive characterized as`` shyster loans'' that the Obama administration extended as part of a bailout to keep the automaker from collapse in 2009. I want to pay back the shyster loans, Sergio Marchionne said at an industry conference, using a derogatory term for an unprincipled lawyer or politician.`` Pay back the loans, get those out and then take( the company) public.'' Donald Rumsfeld : Maybe We Needed More Troops by Staff President Bush U.S. Defense Donald Rumsfeld is conceding`` it's possible'' too few troops were sent to invade Iraq. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC in an interview to be broadcast on`` Nightline'' Monday. President Bush has written that the troop level in Iraq was`` the most important failure in the execution of the war.''

And so was born` the special comment''-- his first one coming in August 2006, rebutting a speech that then-Defense Donald Rumsfeld had delivered to the American Legion. Said Keith Olbermann that night: The confusion we-- as its citizens-- must now address, is stark and forbidding. But variations of it have faced our forefathers, when men like Nixon and McCarthy and Curtis LeMay have darkened our skies and obscured our flag. minister of state for antiquities Zahi Hawass said on Sunday. The objects missing from the famed museum included`` a gilded wood statue of the 18th Dynasty king Tutankhamun being carried by a goddess'' and parts of a gilded wood statue of Tutankhamun harpooning, Zahi Hawass said in a statement.
